details: “N” is the fourteenth letter of the modern English alphabet. It represents the /n/ sound, as in 'nest'. The letter 'N' is commonly found in words related to nature, numbers, and navigation.

wordsData.definition: a structure or location where birds or other animals lay their eggs and raise their young
wordsData.example: The bird built its nest in the tree.

wordsData.definition: the part of the face or head that is used for smelling and breathing
wordsData.example: She wrinkled her nose at the smell.

wordsData.definition: the period of darkness in each twenty-four hours, typically from sunset to sunrise
wordsData.example: The stars were visible in the night sky.

wordsData.definition: a thin pointed metal pin used to fasten things together or as a part of the body
wordsData.example: He hammered a nail into the wall.

rhymes.name: N is for Night (to the tune of 'Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star')
content: N is for night, so dark and deep,
Stars in the sky, as we go to sleep.
The moon is shining up above,
N is for night, a time to rest and love.

rhymes.name: N is for Nest (to the tune of 'Hickory Dickory Dock')
content: N is for nest in the tree,
Birds make it home, wild and free.
Building with twigs, leaves, and straw,
N is for nest, the bird’s law.
